Articles.Content:
Are there any alternate mirrors for .22?

Squads/amazon servers and Steam are the only official downloads.
No SargeRho, it's not available that way so please don't ask, but if you have KSP on Steam or if you use the patcher, the download will be fairly small.

Download averaging about 180kB/s at the moment.

Get it sorted Squad, EA & Rockstar handle big releases flawlessly, so why shouldn't you!?

Only took a few minutes.

My bandwidths are untroubled by 0.22's awesomeness.
you told e'erybody?
Thank you guys this is wonderful.

First up, Squad, excellent work, excellent communication, excellent game. KSP has consumed me over the past months, keep it up

About 0.22, is there any word on performance optimisations? Such as the impact of high-part-count ships or the burden of having a lot of mods installed?

And I'd like to start a list of mods that are no longer required - not broken mods, as updates will trickle in inevitably.

For example, I assume i can remove subassembly manager now.

Any others to add?

It'd also be useful if users could chime in with reports of mods that *still work*

I'll add my reports once updated.

Cheers,

Pete
Allways seems the downloads favour US over the rest of us, was in with the best for the first time, and now down to 1 meg every few mins..

Get it sorted Squad, EA & Rockstar handle big releases flawlessly, so why shouldn't you!?

I hear you, mate. Squad should totally take notes from EA's flawless releases;-)
Sure goes a lot smoother with the Steam version, I'm loving the science so far.

Great Work Squad update took about 2min and im off to SCIENCE!

~Gizmo~
Anyone know yet whether or not it breaks saves?
Guys, the servers are under heavy load, funny that....

I hear you, mate. Squad should totally take notes from EA's flawless releases;-)

Indeed. Squad should aspire to the majesty of, say, Sim City's release. Now that is how the fat cats roll. Did we tell you the name of the game, boy? We call it riding the gravy train.

About 0.22, is there any word on performance optimisations? Such as the impact of high-part-count ships or the burden of having a lot of mods installed?

Read the change log and the last few KSP weekly, the answer is yes for optimisation. (high part count ships is different!)

And I'd like to start a list of mods that are no longer required

Sub assembly managers as the vanilla now have its own.

It'd also be useful if users could chime in with reports of mods that *still work*

most mods should still work on sand box, for the career, give the modders and user the time to report/update.

Anyone know yet whether or not it breaks saves?

My stock save still works. I've never used mods so unsure there.
Does anyone figured out how to decouple yet? I saw in some video's it can be done. Question is, how? (Space bar doesn't work)

My stock save still works. I've never used mods so unsure there.

Cool, thanks.

I hear you, mate. Squad should totally take notes from EA's flawless releases;-)

Maybe some always-on DRM would help speed things up?

Get on it, Squad!
Is 0.22 compatible with 0.21. Is that i would like to transfer my save file.

Does anyone figured out how to decouple yet? I saw in some video's it can be done. Question is, how? (Space bar doesn't work)

Unless you have a decoupler, just fire each stage into the lower one and burn it off through overheating and exploding.

Not even kidding.

Is 0.22 compatible with 0.21. Is that i would like to transfer my save file.

some players are currently reporting stock save files transferring across.

some players are currently reporting stock save files transferring across.

And are they working properly?

oh yes, yes, yes...

569 kB/s yes ^^
Doing a mun flyby now, i'm loving the science to do!
